sen.j: 陣（じん）は、朝廷において六衛府の武官が整列する場所。
sen.e: Jin was a place where military officers of Rokuefu (six guard divisions) lined up in the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 近衛府・兵衛府･衛門府が陣座（じんざ、杖座（じょうざ）とも）に詰めて交替で上番・勤務を務めた。
sen.e: Officers of Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Hyoefu (Headquarters of the Middle Palace Guards), Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) stood by in Jinza (court, also referred to as Joza) to take turns being on duty.

sen.j: これを陣直（じんちょく）と呼んだ。
後に近衛府の陣座の建物に公卿の会議の場が移されてそれが定番化した。
sen.e: Later, the location of the conference of Kugyo (court nobles) was moved to a building of Jinza (court) of Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) and it became the standard.

sen.j: そのため、こうした公卿達による国政議定の会議を陣定・陣儀などと称した。
sen.e: Therefore, the conference for agreement of affairs of state by such Kugyo (court nobles) was referred to as Jin no sadame or Jingi.
